{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3681948,"name":"Hebert Campos","username":"HEBERT","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/hebert/{size}/225400_2.png","created_at":"2025-07-15T22:51:14.529Z","cooked":"

I’m combining SysId with YAGSL routine tests to determine my drive PID and feedforward gains more accurately.

I’m using MK4i modules with Kraken X60s as drive motors, and I’d like some guidance on how to correctly configure the SysId Analyser tab.

What values should I set for the following?

FEEDFORWARD:

  • Window size
  • Velocity threshold
  • Test duration
  • Max controller output

FEEDBACK:

  • Max controller output
  • Velocity denominator units
  • Controller period
  • Measurement delay
  • Max velocity error
  • Max control effort

I’ve been reading and testing different values for two days, but I don’t feel confident proceeding without reference values to compare.

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2025-07-15T22:51:14.529Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":129,"readers_count":128,"score":80.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":504298,"topic_slug":"how-to-set-sysid-for-swerve-yagsl","display_username":"Hebert Campos","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":66223,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/how-to-set-sysid-for-swerve-yagsl/504298/1","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3681980,"name":"","username":"nstrike","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nstrike/{size}/167038_2.png","created_at":"2025-07-15T23:53:56.867Z","cooked":"

have you looked at the example project? It has a way to run SysId in it.

Analyzing it is a diff story. With Krakens the PID is in rotations.

github.com/BroncBotz3481/YAGSL-Example

src/main/java/frc/robot/subsystems/swervedrive/SwerveSubsystem.java

main 

      
    
          
  1. /**
    2. 
          
  2.  * Command to characterize the robot drive motors using SysId
    3. 
          
  3.  *
    4. 
          
  4.  * @return SysId Drive Command
    5. 
          
  5.  */
    6. 
          
  6. public Command sysIdDriveMotorCommand()
    7. 
          
  7. {
    8. 
          
  8.   return SwerveDriveTest.generateSysIdCommand(
    9. 
          
  9.       SwerveDriveTest.setDriveSysIdRoutine(
    10. 
          
  10.           new Config(),
    11. 
          
  11.           this, swerveDrive, 12, true),
    12. 
          
  12.       3.0, 5.0, 3.0);
    13. 
          
  13. }
    14.

Honestly this needs to be improved but won’t be until 2027 at the earliest.

I did this lines of code using the example, and it’s seems that’s working well, i get some datas and put it on SysId:

image692×240 12.6 KB

My doubt is about what of these values i should change, and which ones i can insert instead:

image448×687 52.5 KB

This is my sysId now with some tests that i did earlier

image1441×863 144 KB

Now I’m using rots/s because you said krakens work with that, where do I find that information for neo and any other motors?

For the window size, i can keep it default? And the Max controller output?

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2025-07-16T00:55:00.754Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":61,"readers_count":60,"score":32.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":504298,"topic_slug":"how-to-set-sysid-for-swerve-yagsl","display_username":"Hebert Campos","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":51887,"username":"nstrike","name":"","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nstrike/{size}/167038_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":66223,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/how-to-set-sysid-for-swerve-yagsl/504298/5","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3682011,"name":"","username":"nstrike","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nstrike/{size}/167038_2.png","created_at":"2025-07-16T01:06:40.080Z","cooked":"

NEO’s drive feedback are in meters per second. the drive feedforward is in meters/second. the drive motor kraken feedback is in pre-gearRatio rot/s.

This is one of the things i need to fix in 2027

nstrike:

feedback

Okay, Just to be sure what i’m doing, for my drive wheel FEEDFORWARD which runned by kraken i need to select meters/second on SysID, and for my drive wheel FEEDBACK i should select rot/s, right?

One last question, to use the Ks, Ka and kv value i just need to create a simple motor and replace feedforward values? As this 2 lines of code

SimpleMotorFeedforward feedforward = new SimpleMotorFeedforward(driveKS, driveKV, driveKA);

swerveDrive.replaceSwerveModuleFeedforward(feedforward);

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2025-07-16T01:20:08.270Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":52,"readers_count":51,"score":20.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":504298,"topic_slug":"how-to-set-sysid-for-swerve-yagsl","display_username":"Hebert Campos","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":66223,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/how-to-set-sysid-for-swerve-yagsl/504298/7","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3682053,"name":"","username":"nstrike","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nstrike/{size}/167038_2.png","created_at":"2025-07-16T03:58:17.964Z","cooked":"
HEBERT:

Just to be sure what i’m doing, for my drive wheel FEEDFORWARD which runned by kraken i need to select meters/second on SysID

Correct.

HEBERT:

drive wheel FEEDBACK i should select rot/s

Almost. Here is another example of something i need to fix. Its logged as meters/second but you need to convert it to pre-gearRatio rotations/second in the sysid settings for TalonFX’s.

HEBERT:

SimpleMotorFeedforward feedforward = new SimpleMotorFeedforward(driveKS, driveKV, driveKA);

swerveDrive.replaceSwerveModuleFeedforward(feedforward);

Correct
